<h2 align="center">
  TechSmart
</h2>
<h3 align="center">
  Richmond Hill, GA
</h3>

---

Source Code for TechSmart website available at [TechSmart](https://techsmartrichmondhill.netlify.app)

## Quick start

1.  **Ensure you have NodeJS, NPM, and Git**

    Ensure you have NodeJS available at [NodeJS.org](https://nodejs.org/)
    
    Ensure you have Node Package Manager available at [NPMJS.com](https://www.npmjs.com) or Yarn available at [yarnpkg.com](https://yarnpkg.com/)

    Ensure you have Git available at [git-scm.com](https://git-scm.com/downloads)

2.  **Clone repository**

    In the command line navigate to the directory you want the source code stored and run:

    ```git clone https://github.com/techsmartrh/techSmart.git```

3.  **Download JavaScript dependencies**

    Navigate into the source code directory
    ```cd techSmart```

    If using NPM run:
    ```npm install```

    If using yarn run:
    ```yarn```

4.  **Run local development server**

    To run local development server to view local changes run
    ```npm run develop``` (using npm) or ```yarn develop```

5.  **Deploy changes**

    Site is deployed to Netlify automatically on changes pushed to this GitHub repository

    To do so run:

    ```git add *``` to stage all changes (replace * with path to specific files if needed)
    ```git commit -m "<Write a commit message to annotate changes>"``` to commit changes to your local repository
    ```git push``` to push changes to the GitHub repository

    Login to Netlify to see the build and deployment has been triggered automatically
